p: Magnetite (Fe 3O 4) is the most explored representative of iron oxides, with remarkable implications for biomedical use [ 63, 64, 65]. Besides facile and significant yield synthesis, Fe 3O 4 particles possess peculiar nanosize-related features, such as surface functionalization, tunable biocompatibility and superparamagnetic behavior [ 66, 67, 68, 69, 70]. The surface modification of magnetite nanoparticles with essential oils represents a bidirectional strategy to obtain multifunctional platforms: (i) firstly, the organic molecules act as modulators for the compatibility and stability of Fe 3O 4 nanoparticles; and (ii) secondly, the inorganic core acts as a stabilizer and potentiating agent for the essential oils [ 71, 72]. By combining these benefits, new and effective therapeutic nanosystems can be provided, with the additional ability of targeted and controlled treatment.
